author: Special Correspondent
text:
The probe into the alleged swindling of singer Manna Dey’s assets from a joint account and locker he held with his nephew Tarit Dey has been reopened by the Metropolitan Magistrate’s Court, Kolkata. The court rejected the police closure report in the case.

The court further noted that a “prima facie case for cheating, well established against the accused person” had been registered and was presently under trial.

The assets allegedly swindled by Tarit Dey include Manna Dey’s collection of rare watches and his wife Sulochana Dey’s jewellery. Apart from that, Rs. 15 lakh in the joint account was also transferred and used up.
title: Probe into assets case reopened
